newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Uncertainty looms over Oct Norscan pulp figures.
newsitem.headline: Uncertainty looms over Oct Norscan pulp figures.

text.p: Uncertainty surrounded North American and Scandinavian (Norscan) pulp stock levels ahead of the announcement of October figures, due later this week, market analysts said on Tuesday.
"Uncertainty looms for the Norscan stock figures. Expectations range from unchanged levels to an increase of 250,000 tonnes for October," one told Reuters.
Last week rumours hit the market of an increase of up to 250,000 tonnes. Later a Finnish forestry company said its forecast was unchanged while another said its was for a rise of 100,000 tonnes.
"My forecast for the stockpile in the end of October is around 1.8 million tonnes," London-based Paribas analyst Hubert de Marliare told Reuters.
This would mean an increase of about 75,000 tonnes from the September figure of 1.73 million tonnes.
The average for the last eight years' October figures is an increase of 40,000 tonnes compared with the previous month.
